nodes.bodyText: Property name is not expected to change. This will break configurations.

I don't see this defined in issue. Following other patters, it should be Pattern[] and not plural.
@romani ping

@romani
A lot of the properties setter have String...  as setter paramter and then is converted to Pattern[]/List<Pattern>. The  properties do not have consistent initiation, as do Pattern property. Some have Pattern as the parameter for setter, but some have String and later conveted to Pattern, although their property type in xdoc is regexp.
For example, staticGroups has filed class Pattern[], but setter type String...

  
    
      checkstyle/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/imports/ImportOrderCheck.java
    
    
         Line 416
      in
      ae324ed
    
    
    
    

        
          
           private Pattern[] staticGroups = EMPTY_PATTERN_ARRAY; 
        
    
  



  
    
      checkstyle/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/imports/ImportOrderCheck.java
    
    
         Line 514
      in
      ae324ed
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public void setStaticGroups(String... packageGroups) { 
        
    
  


I think we should only care about the field class, as is also checked in xdocs tests.
Since the property field has Pattern[] type, the fieldClass check in XdocsPagesTest will produce Pattern[] as the property type.

We should care only about setters, it is how value come to Class.
Type should be String[] in description there should all deails on how it is parsed to inner implementation.

If we have a unique type, Pattern versus Patterns, then we should have a unique section for it.
@romani ping
